Half-Life, a game from the late 90's, and still a great game.
Gordon Freeman, a scientist from the Black Mesa Research Facility, has to fight against aliens and the military after an experiment has gone wrong, creating a rift between dimensions. Using the H.E.V. Suit and whichever working weapons he finds, he will have to go to the world between dimensions named Xen and fight the leader of the alien riot. To do so, he has to navigate through a destroyed Black Mesa, going through the railway, the laboratories, and the surface, heavily guarded by the military aiming to kill the ones who made the supposed experiment, that including Gordon Freeman himself, and reach the Lambda Complex. By this description, it may sound like a short game. But it actually has quite the challenges. You'll need to crouch through tight areas, jump over hazardous liquids, and shoot everything you see. I consider this game to be a Shooting-Platformer, due to the amount of challenges required to take alternative routes through destroyed rooms requiring jumping skills.
Oh, and it also has a Multiplayer mode. I haven't played on it much, but it seems pretty good. Hence why there's also a mod for HL mainly based on Multiplayer, which is Counter-Strike. So good that it was even released as it's own game and sequels.
If you don't like the old-fashioned models, there is also a Free-to-download HD Pack.

Прошло почти 20 лет с момента, когда действия мистера Фримена вызвали каскадный резонанс на персональных компьютерах. И неудивительно, ибо для шутера HL был чем-то новым.
В первую очередь, это не тупой тир, а экшен с сюжетом, раскрываемым от первого лица. Это правдоподобный мир нацчно-исследовательского комплекса Black Mesa, где все вас знают, а в момент беды - на вас надеются и активно помогают преодолевать трудности.

Пусть даже прохождение уровней напоминает отстрел недругов в абсолютно линейных уровнях, но они весьма разнообразны, разбавлены открытыми пространствами, ловушками и, что важнее всего, интерактивными элементами с активным использованием физики (ну или ее подобия, насколько позволяет движок Gold Src), и порой требующих переключить внимание со стрельбы на решение мини-головоломки.
То, что к этой шедевральной игре еще делают модификации, а в Steam вышел ремейк Black Mesa, лишь подтверждает то, что. несмотря на свой почтенный возраст, формула Half-Life до сих пор успешна и устаревает в нем лишь графика.

Half-Life is a fps featuring enemies of all sizes, mostly traditional conventional weaponry, a bit of platforming, and friendly npcs to work with.  The game has been modded time and time again in to complete spinoff games (Counterstrike, Team Fortress, Opposing Forces, Blue Shift, Ricochet, to name the most recognized).  The base game features the single player game and basic deathmatch.  Public servers are still running, and can still be set up.  The single player game has a bland storyline with an open ending.  It still is a lot of fun offering high replay value with extensive, abeit linear, levels.  If you like fpses, but have never played it, make sure to try it at least once.  This is the game that was the cornerstone for the history for most modern day fpses, even more so than Doom and Duke Nukem.

Half-Life, a game created in 1998, was the reason I became interested in PC gaming. I first started gaming on a macbook pro and eventually I partitioned the hard drive and had it running windows in 2012, and then I finally got a PC in 2013. The point of this pointless backstory is to demonstrate how influential this game truly is. I am four months younger than Half Life itself, and yet this game has, to me, done more than stand the test of time. It was truly revolutionary in terms of story driven shooters. And what is even more incredible is that Half-Life is the first fps in which the player forms a profound connection to the protagonist, and without uttering a single word, Gordon Freeman becomes more than just a character to the player. 

     The player and Gordon become one, locked together in an enormous research facility under siege by not only aliens, but those who are expected to protect civilian life. Gordon must navigate an extremely hazardous environment filled with hostile aliens and soldiers. They must overcome the odds as one and survive a harrowing journey through the heart of the doomed research facility. Half-Life is completely driven by the player. There are no cutscenes. The player is constantly immersed in the game. It has a perfect blend of diverse and complicated level design, while simultaneously guiding the player in a particular direction without the player feeling constrained.  There are no hints. The player themself must discover how to proceed at each obstacle.

     These are only a few of the reasons why in my opinion Half-Life is actually the greatest game of all time, and although I will concede that some of my reasons for believing this are obviously biased and based on personal preferences, I believe it certainly must be recognized as one of the greatest, most revolutionary games to ever be created.

Half-Life is a rather good game, it was created by Gaben when he left Microsoft, so it has an important place in the history of Valve (Well... of course it does, it's Half-Life).

Half-Life runs on the Gold Source engine, which is a modded version of the quake engine.

The games mechanics are, shoot things and they die (even your "allies"), blow things up they die.... apart from the obvious mechanics, there are also puzzle elements, such as operating valves inorder to progress or placing boxes in the right areas to progress. 

The feedback interface of this game is really well done, the HEV suit feedsback to the player through sounds and on screen imagery. When you take damage, the suit will inform you of it. The suit also shows your oxygen levels while you are under water or the power level of your torch.

The main type of enemies you will be fighting are aliens, there are also humans to fight as well.

You get a good range of weapons to use, from a pistol, to energy weapons.

A really nice game to play, you should buy it, if you haven't already.

This game is the example of a true classic masterpiece. The enviourment is dark, the deaths are very abrupt, and the enimies are ruthless. Half-Life is sure to keep you on the edge of your seat and constantly fueling the feeling of paranoia in the back of your mind. 

What makes this game so unique is the fact it is a puzzle in itself. This isnt like most of the other games that gave you your classic objectives and kicked you in the but expecting you to "get er done". Half-Life required that you used your mind to solve little escape puzzles. These puzzles ranged from, opening an oversized heater vent to activating oversized prones to a massive generator. 

Now, lets talk about the dangers. theres alot in half-life that wants to kill you. Oversized fans are sure to turn those bones into processed alien brunch, and lets not forgert about those "Large falls of doom" Miss a ledge and its a long way down complimented by a nice crunch and the sound of your heart monitor flat lining. 

Overall this is an amazing game that you must add to your collection. My step dad intoroduced me to it before he passed away, and I still find myself playing this game every now and then. I reccomend you play the game while listening to trance music, it makes it go so much smoother as my stepfather showed me.
